fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a user has more than 40 starred spaces, the list of spaces won't list all of them, being limited to 40 spaces. 
This will make it impossible to access certain spaces.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Star (favourite) 50 spaces
# Access Confluence using Android's app
# Select *Spaces* at the bottom and scroll down trough the list

h3. Expected Results
It should list all starred spaces

h3. Actual Results
Only 40 spaces are shown:
|  !Screenshot_20201008-213513_Confluence.png|thumbnail! |
| !Screenshot_20201008-213519_Confluence.png|thumbnail! |
| !Screenshot_20201008-213527_Confluence.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
Use the Search to look for the desired page inside of the space you want to access.
fields.summary: Android mobile app limits the list of spaces to 40

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copying a page tree that contains a page restricted to edit by another user fails when creates page properties.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As User 1
 ## Create a new space named SRC with default permissions.
 ## Create a new blank page.
 ## Set page restrictions on the newly created page so that only User 1 can edit.
 # As User 2:
 ## Create a new space named DEST with default permissions.
 ## Use the copy page hierarchy to copy the SRC home page to the DEST home page.
 ### Set copyAttachments, copyPermissions, copyProperties, copyLabels = true.
 ### Use a unique prefix (e.g. [TEST]).
 ## Poll the long task API.

Request example:
{code:java}
POST {{baseurl}}/rest/api/content/<source_home_id>/pagehierarchy/copy
{
  "copyAttachments": true,
  "copyProperties": true,
  "copyLabels": true,
  "copyPermissions": true,
  "destinationPageId": "<destination_home_id>",
  "titleOptions": {
    "prefix": "[COPY] "
  }
}
{code}
 
h3. Expected Results

The long task percentageComplete eventually reaches 100
h3. Actual Results
 * The long task percentageComplete never reaches 100
 * The long task keeps advancing until some point, then resets to 0 and starts over
 * Errors in the logs appear a few minutes after the call (and repeating every few minutes after that):

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Table of Contents Macro does not go to the expected header destination if heading in the table header.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Table of Contents Macro on the page
 # Below on the page, Add single-column tables and put heading in the table header.
 # Publish the page and click on the TOC

h3. Expected Results

The user being skip directly to the information they’re looking for. 

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens when you click on it.

h3. Workaround

Remove the heading row option for the table and put a color on the top row:

# Edit the page and access the table.
# Tap the table and then, *Table options*
# Uncheck the *Header row* option
# Select the whole row and then, tap the little icon for *Cell options* so a color can be applied to it, making it similar to a header:
!row_color.png|thumbnail!

(i) You can also only remove the *Header row* option or change it to *Heading column* as it will not trigger the bug.
fields.summary: Table of Contents Macro does not navigate if heading in the table header.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
if we search the question with just the first word of the question (Finnish word), it will not return the result, it doesn’t show the suggestions for the existing questions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Go to confluence question addon and search for question using first word, ex:testing
 !image-2020-10-08-19-28-00-628.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
Questions with word "testing" should show in the suggestion list but it shows only create"testing"
 !image-2020-10-08-19-30-32-849.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
It shows create option.

Note: If we search first word "testing " and add space, it shows the results.
 !image-2020-10-08-19-32-18-916.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
- Search with first word and space.
- Search by incomplete word, it will show the suggestion for related results.
fields.summary: Unable to search questions using first word

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Create from template macro that doesn´t update correctly when moved from one space to another space. The meeting note will be added to the old space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Create a page and add create from template macro
 # Now move the page to another space
# Click creates from template macro and then publish the template.

h3. Expected Results

The page will be located in the new space.

h3. Actual Results

The page is located in the old space.

h3. Workaround

Once the page is moved to the new space, edit the macro and click save.
fields.summary: Create from template doesn´t update correctly when moved

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JIRA filters for some tenants are returning error when used inside JIM.

We can fix it using the Governator tool: Refresh Application links data but after a while, the problem appears again.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira filter
 # Create a JIM with the filter created in step 1

h3. Expected Results
 # JIRA macro should show tickets based on Jira filtered results

h3. Actual Results

Error is displayed in JIM asking user to refresh

A query on prod returns the following stack trace:
{noformat}
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'isCustomFields' in class com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.DefaultJiraIssuesColumnManager threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at templates/extra/jira/staticJiraIssues.vm[line 315, column 76]
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

 

Potential workaround: Disable using Jira filters and use JQL instead
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macro returns template error when using some Jira filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to [export Confluence pages|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/export-content-to-word-pdf-html-and-xml/] and spaces to various formats, including PDF.

Recently, it seems that those exports size have increased, even though no more pages or attachments were added to the pages/space to be exported into PDF.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space
 # Add some pages in the space
 # Go to space *Settings > content tools*
 # Click on *Export*
 # Choose the option *export* to *PDF*
 # Choose either *Full* or *Custom* export
 # Click *Export*

h3. Expected Results
Export to PDF size didn't increased much from one export to another, if the content hasn't changed much too.

h3. Actual Results
The size difference between PDFs export increased a lot. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Size of PDF upon export has increased

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We we use a table in include page macro the table header do not stick on top of page while scrolling the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a page and insert a table.
 !image-2020-10-07-15-46-20-318.png|thumbnail! 
 # Step 2 Create another page insert a page include macro and select the page, created in first step.
 !image-2020-10-07-15-47-16-634.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Table header should stick on the top of the page while scrolling the page.
 !image-2020-10-07-15-48-05-344.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Table header do not stick on the top of the page while scrolling the page.
 !image-2020-10-07-15-48-56-982.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Header row in table do not stick on top of page in page include macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a page using the legacy editor, if we place an Attachments macro and then insert a date macro, when editing that date macro the date picker will be cut, preventing Saturday to be shown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in the legacy editor template
# Add an Attachments macro
# Add a date macro and select any date
# Publish the page and edit it again
# Click on the date macro to open the date picker

h3. Expected Results
The date picker should display correctly
|  !Screen Shot 2020-10-06 at 22.06.27.png|thumbnail!  |

h3. Actual Results
The date picker is cut, preventing Saturday to be displayed
|  !Screen Shot 2020-10-06 at 22.05.15.png|thumbnail!  |

h3. Workaround
Either refresh/ reload the editor or remove the attachments macro.
fields.summary: Attachments macro will make the date picker to be cut on the legacy editor
Jira issue/filter macro is not showing information from custom URL field created in Jira

fields.description: We manage updates from a set of specific statuses listed on Confluence documents. It would be nice if the Statuses could be dropdowns so I don't have to "remember" what the values are and make sure that other users use the same statuses. It would also be awesome if we could report on those values.
fields.summary: Drop Down list for status

fields.description:
Currently, the comment count in Confluence Analytics reflects the total number of comments on a page *since the page's creation*; not what's currently on the page. 

What would be incredibly helpful would be to *limit the count to only current/open comments*, as this would serve as a call-to-action from a content management perspective.
fields.summary: Comment Count in Confluence Analytics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Issue/filter on Confluence shows the wrong number of issues at the end of the list and also limited to 100
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new *page*
 # Insert a *JIRA Issue/Filter*
 # *Search* for more than 100 issues
 # Click on *Display options*
 # On *Maximum issues* write the number 1000
 # Click on the button *Insert*

h3. Expected Results
 * At the end of the page, you should see "Showing 105 out of 105 issues" and all of the issues listed, or at least, should create numbered pages to display all issues

h3. Actual Results
 * At the end of the page, you see "Showing 1000 out of 105 issues" and a maximum of 100 issues listed

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Issue shows wrong number of issues and limited to 100

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding an Agile Wallboard Gadget in a Confluence page to show a Jira Software board using swimlanes based on Assignee doesn't show the information properly. The name of the first user in the swimlanes doesn't appear, but the tickets of the user show in the columns backlog, in progress, done (for example).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Software Kanban project;
# Create a Kanban board using swimlanes based on Assignees
# Create a Confluence page;
# Add an Agile Wallboard Gadget to the page;
# Select the board to show in the Gadget;

h3. Expected Results
The Gadget will show the columns of the board (backlog, in progress, done, ...), the users, and their tickets.

h3. Actual Results
The name of the first user in the swimlanes doesn't show in the Gadget and the user's tickets appear inside the columns names.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget doesn't show the name of the first user of a board using swimlanes based on Assignees

fields.description:
Hello,

fields.description:
*Issue*
 JIRA Issue Macro in the Confluence page is using Display URL while the Application URL is unreachable.

*Replication steps*
 1.Link Jira server and confluence cloud.
 2.Ensure that the Display URL and the Base URL of Confluence and JIRA is using the proxied URL.
 3.Create a page in Confluence and insert a JIRA Issue Macro.

*EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR*
 The JIRA macro issue links should redirecting to Display URL: [https://helpdesk-vn.xyz.com\|https://helpdesk-vn.xyz.com/] (this is Jira server URL)

*ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR*
 The JIRA issue macro links redirecting to Application URL: [https://jiraz.xyz.com|https://jiraz.xyz.com/]; this is proxy URL) instead of Display URL: [https://helpdesk-vn.xyz.com\|https://helpdesk-vn.xyz.com/] (this is Jira server URL)

*Note*
 If we access the single issue link then it works fine.
fields.summary: Jira macro URL links not working according to configured display URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users is not in list of suggestion in Auto Complete/Mentions if the "Full name" is multibyte language like Japanese.
It works fine if the "Public name" is multibyte language.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create user like below
 #* Full name : 山田太郎
 #* Public name : Yamada tarou
 # Edit a page 
 # Input "@山田"

h3. Expected Results
The user *is* in the list of the suggestion.

h3. Actual Results
The user *isn't* in the list of the suggestion.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users is not in list of suggestion in Auto Complete/Mentions if the "Full name" is multibyte language like Japanese.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *JIRA Issue/Filter* macro, setting Table view and selecting a *Select List* custom fields under *Columns to display* will prevent the macro from displaying the results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Select List* custom field on Jira
 # Create an issue on Jira and set that field
 # In a Confluence page, insert a JIRA Issue/Filter macro and find that issue created on step 2
 # Set the macro to *Table* under *Display Options*
 # Add the field created on step 1 to the *Columns to display*
 # Save the macro and publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The JIRA Issue/Filter macro should display the results
h3. Actual Results

The JIRA Issue/Filter macro will show the following error:
{quote}(!) Refresh didn't work. Try again or click an issue to see it in JIRA.
{quote}
No errors in the browser's console or in the requests.
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only available workaround is to remove the *Select List* custom field from the *Columns to display* in the Jira macro.
fields.summary: Jira macro can't list issues when there's a Select List custom field listed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to [setup public access|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-public-access/] to the entire instance or particular spaces in Confluence.

When the anonymous users access those public spaces, the space logo and the space name turns into a grey bar instead, and the overview page on the left bar is gone, leaving only the page tree visible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new space 
 # Create a new page and publish it
 # In space Settings, make sure to open it to anonymous user (at least view permissions)
 # In the global permission settings, open the instance to be accessible to anonymous users
 # Copy the published page or space URL link and open it on incognito/in private window of your browser

h3. Expected Results
You'll be able to see the overview page in the left sidebar and the space logo/space name.

h3. Actual Results
The overview page name in the left side bar isn't there and the space name and logo are greyed out.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Space logo and Space name not showing for anonymous users, even if it is open to public access

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Date Picker macro (the one we call with *//*) is a great feature we can use to work with deadlines on our pages! The way it works by default when we insert a date is:
 * *{color:#0747a6}Blue{color}*: there is more than a week until reaching that date;
 * *{color:#ff8b00}Orange{color}*: we are reaching the date within a week;
 * *{color:#DE350B}Red{color}*: the date has been reached.

And this is an excellent visual feature to understand how we are with the date set.
h3. Suggestion
 * Add some additional features on this macro to customize how we are going to work with the deadlines of the date, like changing when that macro will turn into orange, customizing when we want them to get red.
fields.summary: Customize the Date Picker macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the Confluence Cloud Premium Analytics feature provides us a lot of different types of insights about our spaces and pages, as well as the possibility to export the data to a spreadsheet, so we can manipulate a cool report from our end the way we want.

h3. Suggestion
* It would be great if the ability to see insights of how many times a page was shared with a group/user or if it was used the tiny link to share the page, as this way we can measure how our content is being relevant.
fields.summary: Ability to track how many times pages are being shared

fields.description:
As a meeting organizer I want to have an option in task reports to display tasks for "all tasks on the same level and below" so I can easily create reports for all tasks within a series or within a logical unit.

Consider this structure:
 * Weekly Tech Meeting
 ** 2020-10-05 Kick Off
 ** 2020-10-06 Requirements
 ** 2020-10-09 Check-in
 ** ...
 * Bi-Weekly Strategy Meeting
 ** 2020-10-09 Strategy Meeting
 ** 2020-10-23 Strategy Meeting
 ** ...
 ** 

You want to place an "open tasks" report on every of these 2 meeting series. Both series use the same custom page template.

Use case one is to have a report on the parent page for each meeting.

Use case two (more important) is to have a report on every page of the meeting series, which shows open tasks in that series, so you can open you meeting by reviewing the currently open tasks. 

Currently you can place a task report on each of the sub-pages and _*manually*_ choose the parent - however this approach does not scale well. The template should not map to a specific parent page but allow to display tasks from pages "on the same level". 

Proposed Solution:
 * Add option to task report macro to show tasks for "All tasks on siblings and below" 
 * Add option to task report macro to show tasks for "All tasks on parent" 

Please note, this feature would be amazingly useful in Conjunction with the App "Meetical Meetings for Confluence" - Disclaimer: I'm the author of the App ;)

Thank You!
fields.summary: Add "Tasks from child pages" option to show task reports

fields.description:
Problem: You want to display a list of Confluence pages in the order as they appear in the hierarchy tree. 

Why? Because this is a way to add a custom sort order to a list of pages. On Cloud it's fast, because it's drag and drop. 

Available Reports:

Page Properties Report: (x) Does not allow you to sort by "custom order from hierarchy tree"

Content Report Table: (x) Does not allow you to sort by "custom order from hierarchy tree"

Workaround:

Use a "Children Display" Report: (!) However, this is quite limited and not as nice as the Page Properties Report. 

It would be great to have that search order option also on the Page Properties Report. My use case is, that I have a list of Epics which we refine on Confluence before creating individual Jira Tickets for it. (see Screenshot)
fields.summary: Allow sorting reports by custom order from the hierarchy tree

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary Page links don't get updated when copying a page tree: * One core feature in K15t Scroll Documents app is versioning, which is enabled by making copies of page trees using the copypagehierarchy REST endpoint. * Customers of the app have been reporting that links within these page trees don't get updated when creating a version. The expected behaviour when I copy a page A with a child page B, and page A contains a link to page B, is that the copy of page A will link to the copy of page B, not to the original page B. * This is a critical bug, as it affects a core feature in a popular app. h3. Steps to Reproduce n/a h3. Expected Results Usually I would expect page links to be stored like this in storage format:  {code:java} {code} What we would need is one of the following: * Either the editor needs to save links with proper page references again and all the links with absolute URLs that have been created in the meantime need to be migrated (this is the preferred solution, as I assume that absolute URLs cause more problems than just ours, for example during import/export) * Or the `copypagehierarchy` REST endpoint needs to update absolute links h3. Actual Results When I was testing recently with Confluence Cloud, I noticed that links were saved with absolute URLs: {code:java} Page 4{code} This seems to have changed again. When I insert a link to a page now, it is inserted like this: {code:java} Page 4{code} Funnily, when viewing the page, this shows as a card with the page title, while in the export format (which we use for rendering the document), it shows the specified link body. When I specify a link text manually, the links are still stored with an absolute URL. h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page links don't get updated when copying a page tree via copypagehierarchy API

fields.description:
Tests in the full edit/quick edit jobs have been flaky. I debugged one of the tests - testCreatingATableOpensToolbar.

1) The pageobjects plugin was monorepoed few years back and deprecated. Some of the editor webdriver tests

still reference classes in the external repo. 

2) This could be the reason for the Guice configuration errors which I could reproduce locally as well. I updated

the deprecated reference and was able to get past the configuration error.

3) After I got past Step 2, the test still failed because it was using an invalid css selector. I corrected the selector

and the test passed. Not sure why this test doesn't always fail.

4) There are some references to TinyMCE in the pageobjects plugin. Maybe these need to be updated.
fields.summary: Flaky test - testCreatingATableOpensToolbar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Confluence Cloud, [we have an integration with Slack to use it together|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-slack-and-confluence-together/], and one of the functionalities is the /confluence search.

When you do a search, for a page, for example /confluence search <text>, it shows up the results, however, when you click on the *Show 5 more results* button, it only shows up the same 5 results again.
 To be able to see more results, you need to click on the *View in Confluence* button.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have a integration set between a space in Confluence and Slack first
 # On the channel linked to the space through the integration, trigger the search by typing */confluence search <text>*
 # After the results are shown, click on the *Show more 5 results* button

h3. Expected Results
It shows more 5 results on the list.

h3. Actual Results
It repeats the same 5 results instead of actually showing more 5 results.

h3. Workaround
View the results directly on Confluence.
fields.summary: Confluence - Slack integration search show 5 more results is only repeating the same results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Fabric pages show styles of TinyMCE in the app iframe, affecting Stiltsoft's [Courses and Quizzes - LMS for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214110/courses-and-quizzes-lms-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] app as far as we know.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

When participants (users of the app) are taking a course, it happens on the app portal in the app iframe. Pages that are included in a course as modules are rendered while playing a course using the [Convert content body API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content-body/#api-api-contentbody-convert-to-post].

Using this REST API the app renders page content from *Storage* to View and are getting the following resources via expand: webresource.uris.js,webresource.uris.css,webresource.superbatch.uris.js,webresource.superbatch.uris.css. The app gets these CSS resources with the old styles (the way they would look in the legacy editor) while the pages that we are rendering are using the new editor.

Given Atlassian suggestion to use different API configurations, tried rendering page content from *ADF* (instead of Storage) to View without success. The response for the request that uses the 'atlas_doc_format' representation was the same as the one with 'storage' representation.

For example, a page looks like this when a user looks at it directly *in Confluence*:

!bc664c6b-a9b6-4d90-b548-b90e255b790d.png!
h3. Expected Results
 * Page should be displayed in the new content style inside a course, same as the above screenshot
 * However the expected results can be achieved, the API's documentation should provide clear guidance to developers how to do so.

h3. Actual Results

This is how the same example page looks like (incorrectly displayed in the old content style) *inside a course* (i.e. via the app)

!b5f5fcc7-ecd8-47b8-8b43-b3a32583e605.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Fabric pages show styles of TinyMCE in the app iframe

The following example description could be found here: Establishing and guaranteeing the necessary framework for the development of the above-mentioned organization.

# Create a page using the global template.

*Note:* Above text is the tested on where the error occurs. There could be more such sentences where errors could occur. No such pattern is found.

The variable-name text should appear as it is instead of '[object Object]'.

 !image-2020-10-02-17-45-03-479.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
By default, when using a numbered list, the only method to continue the numbers is if the user either hits *Enter* (or *shift+Enter* to add something between the numbers and then, continue it with *Enter*).

In certain scenarios, users use [layouts|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-formatting-to-your-page/#Addformattingtoyourpage-layouts] to put an image/macro at the side of the numbered list. In this case, if the user adds a new layout, there is no method to continue the numbered list and the user must add a new one that will start from the number 1.

h3.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to allow numbered lists to continue in the next layout in order to allow steps to use images at their right side.

At the moment, the closest workaround would be to:

* Include the image between the current numbered list (not using layouts) by using *Shift+Enter* and then *Enter* to go to the next number.
* In a table, use the *Numbered column* option for each of the numbered points instead of layouts.
fields.summary: Continuous numbered list between layouts

fields.description:
*Request:*

Add the ability to extend the csv export capabilities from current fields, all fields to include an option to export project fields when a single project is selected in the query or when multiple projects who use the same screen scheme are included in the query. 

If the projects included in the query do not have the same screen scheme, grey out the project field export capabilities. 

 

*Case*:

In a lot of scenarios the all fields export is extremely excessive and rarely do any issues ever use all the fields in the system if ever.  The current field export is great but setting up the initial saved filter with all the columns can be tedious especially when working in a lot of projects. Providing the ability to export the project fields will cut down on this time on setting up and exporting your data for a specific project.
fields.summary: Extend CSV Export to include project fields option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
`contentIdState` is not set for the `PageContext` consumer when transitioning between pages on the same space.

This is causing the `page dwell` event to not fire when moving between pages on the same space. See `DwellTime.js` and `DwellTimeComponent.js` in confluence-frotnend.

The `page dwell` event is a critical event for Search & Smarts

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
Search for something via the horizontal nav search. Note that the `search_id` gets stripped from the URL which is an indicator that the dwell timer has started (see `DwellTimeComponent.js#startDwell`).

 # Step 2
Search for something else in the same space as the previous search. Note that the `search_id` does NOT get stripped.

# Step 3
Check analytics plugin to see that no `page dwell` event is fired for the new page.

h3. Expected Results
The `search_id` gets stripped on any page transition. The `page dwell` event is also fired for every page. 

h3. Actual Results
The `search_id` does not stripped on page transition between pages on the same space. The `page dwell` event is not fired when moving from page to page. 

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: `contentIdState` is not set for the `PageContext` consumer when transitioning between pages on the same space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using certain complex filters in the JIRA Issue/Filter macro or in Jira gadgets such as the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics macro, it will either fail to display the preview or throw a 504 status error at the UI.

The filter used can either be a complex filter that takes a considerable amount of time to process or it will return a high number of issues.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a complex filter on Jira
 # Use this filter on Confluence, in the JIRA Issue/Filter macro or the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics one

h3. Expected Results

The macro should display its preview.
h3. Actual Results
 * For the JIRA Issue/Filter macro, the following error is thrown at the UI:
{code:none}
Received the following HTTP error code from the server:504{code}

 * For the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics macro, it simply won't save the settings and won't display the preview. The following response comes from the request:
{code:none}
throw 1; < don't be evil' >{"https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/gadget/1.0/twodimensionalfilterstats/generate?filterId=filter-13877&xstattype=issuetype&sortDirection=asc&sortBy=total&ystattype=assignees&numberToShow=5":{"rc":504,"headers":{},"body":""}}{code}

In both cases, the request takes 10 seconds to fail.

We also noticed the issue is intermittent. For some cases, the filter may not work at the first attempt but trying again might work.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no other workaround besides decreasing the filter's complexity so it can return results quicker.
fields.summary: Jira macros and gadgets failing with 504 (gateway timeout) error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some pages with large elements are slow to load on initial page RENDER. This issue is separate from slowness experience when trying to EDIT the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a lot of large elements such as tables or macros.
 # Navigate to the page.

h3. Expected Results
Page loads quickly with all elements.

h3. Actual Results
Page takes more than 10 seconds to load. 

h3. Workaround
Split up the page and the contents like tables and macros.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Instances in which the base name starts with wiki (*wikitest.atlassian.net*, for example) the Recently Updated Macro and the Recently Updated dashboard are not working properly. The macros load the pages properly, however the link to the pages are broken, with the base URL duplicated, for example:
{code:java}
https://wikitest.atlassian.net/wikitest.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SPACEKEY>/pages/<PAGEID>/<PAGETITLE>{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Instance which its name starts with wiki (i.e. *wikisomething*)
 # Create a page.
 # Add the Recently Updated Macro on it.
 # Publish the page.
 # Click on a link from the macro (make sure to have updated some pages recently).

h3. Expected Results

The links should work properly.
h3. Actual Results

The links don't work as expected, as the base URL will be duplicated on it.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When [moving a page to a different space|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/] that does not have a home page, by searching for the space name and then, selecting the suggestion, it will redirect the user to the space in question while the Move dialog is still displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(i) Make sure to have a space not containing a home page.
# On an existing page, make sure to tap the ellipsis button at the top right and select *Move*
# Select the *Advanced* option
# Type the name of a space that does not have a home page.
# Tap the space name's suggestion

h3. Expected Results
The user should be kept on the same page until the *Move* action is executed

h3. Actual Results
The user is redirected to the space without a home page while the Move dialog is still displayed. A video has been recorded to demonstrate the phenomenon:

 [^move_phenomenon.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. Still, you can use the *Move* option as it will properly work.
fields.summary: Tapping a space name (without a home page) while moving a page redirects the user to the space

fields.description:
Current situation:
* Currently when linking a Jira Issue to a Confluence page, users are able to pull specific fields from Issues using *Jira Issue Macro* (and adding/removing fields from *Display options*).
* This process however is a manual one, so every time you need to report on a different (individual) issue, the user would have to go through each Jira Issue macro, updating them with another issue Key.

Desired Feature:
* Provide users with a template / macro that would automatically update Jira Issue macros on a page, just by adding its issue key and selecting the desired fields to be displayed.
* So whenever the user desires to link a new Issue, they'd just create a page based on this template, add the issue key a single time, and every macro on the page, reporting on this specific issue's fields, would be displayed.
* This could be a time saver for companies that rely on complex pages, that have to manually update many Jira Issue Macros when reporting on Jira Issues.
fields.summary: Provide users with a template or macro that would automatically update all Jira Issue macros on a page, by entering a Issue Key a single time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Although it's not possible to re-name a Blueprint (we have this feature request:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30926 to track our customers' interest on it), Confluence allows you to edit it, and set a new title. The new title won't reflect to the UI (neither on the Templates list or the creation dialog), however the title is updated on Template editor UI and on the Audit Log.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Confluence.
 # Navigate to a Space.
 # Click on *Space Settings > Content Tools*.
 # Edit a Blueprint (for example, *Product roadmap*).
 # Set a new title.
 # Save the template.

h3. Expected Results

The template editor shouldn't allow you to set a new title.
h3. Actual Results

A new entry will be created on the Template lists, however the title would remain the original one:

!image-2020-09-29-13-11-26-701.png!

The change is also logged on the Audit Log:

!image-2020-09-29-13-12-24-158.png!

When accessing the Blueprint on edit mode, the new title will be used:

  !image-2020-09-29-14-29-31-384.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Renaming a Blueprint is not working as expected

h3. Issue Summary

Jira issues show as a hyperlink when used with page property report macro
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with page property macro.
 # Add a table to page property macro > Add a Jira issue in one of the column/rows
 # Create another page and add page property report macro, it will show the Jira issue as *Jira issue macro link*.
 # Now go back to the page you created with a page property macro and edit it.
 # Load the page with a page property report macro, it will now show the Jira issue link as just *hyperlink*

h3. Expected Results

Once you edit the page with page property macro, the Jira issue in page property report macro should still show the issues with Jira issues
h3. Actual Results

It shows as a hyperlink

h3. Workaround
 Currently, the only workaround is to edit the page property macro and place the link with /Jira issues macro. 
 And if this page needs an edit > after publishing again edit the page and place the issue link with Jira issue macro.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the new editing experience, you can create new templates and insert a placeholder on the same, alongside another options.

However, if you click twice on the placeholder or press tab, making the placeholder text to be selected, and starts typing, it causes the text to be typed backwards and the placeholder color stays (gray).

It seems to be affecting only user created templates.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new template (it can be global or at a space level)
 # Insert some placeholders and texts there
 # Save the template
 # Create a new page based on the template create
# Click twice on the placeholder to select it or press tab;
# Start typing 


h3. Expected Results
Text replaces the placeholder and it is on the right orientation.

h3. Actual Results
The text is typed backwards and the placeholder isn't replaced with the text, it stays as a placeholder.

h3. Workaround
Click on the placeholder, without selecting and start typing. It should erase the placeholder and the text to be typed normally on the page.
If the bug has already triggered on the placeholder, select and delete it and start typing normally.
fields.summary: When a placeholder is selected and you start typing, causes the text to be typed backwards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the new editing experience, we're able to use Smart Links with a variety of links, such as google drive, dropbox, figma and box links.

However, even though it works for app.box.com links to be rendered as smart links if the same are pasted from the share copy link, the same don't work if the link is not from the share link on box.com and if the link has the name of the company, such as companyname.box.com/s/filename instead of app.box.com/s/filename, the links doesn't render as smart links.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Paste a link from box.com from the share file link that has the similar link companyname.box.com/s/filename
 # With the same URL link, replace the companyname with the "app" word, it should be like app.box.com/s/filename


h3. Expected Results
Both URLs links are valid and render as Smart Links

h3. Actual Results
Only the link as app.box.com/s/filename render as a Smart Link

h3. Workaround
Replace the companyname.box.com to use the app.box.com to render it as a smart link or use the ctrl + k (link macro) to enter the link a name to the file link shared.
fields.summary: Smart Links not working with Box links if the same don't start with app.box.com on URLs

fields.description:
Hi,
it would be great if you can add a breadcrumb to results in search bar.

We use to have more documents with the same name but under different "folders" and now we have to create a sort of breadcrumb in the title so we can recognize every document in the search bar without to open it. The only problem with this solution is the title length, sometimes it becomes very very long. 

Now I discovered also a bug. 
While I'm writing there is something charging and I see a spinner near "Create another" checkbox. Every time it stops loading the cursor go to a new line. Is very
 annoying as I have to press 
backspace every time. Here you can see the 
result if I don't 
use backspace and continue to write, every
 few words 
it goes to a new line. And if I'm editing a word in another part of the document it put the cursor at the end and I have to click with the mouse to put the cursor in place.
I hope this suggestions can help you to improve the product.

Best regards,
Fabio
fields.summary: Breadcrumb

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* When exporting a page that contains links to other Confluence pages to Word, the generated file end up pointing to broken links, instead of links to these pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page, give it a name, and paste a link to another Confluence page > Publish the page;
 # Click on ••• > Export to word;
 # Edit the exported file in Word;

h3. Expected Results
 * Link to correctly point to Confluence page :
 *{{https://<InstanceName>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SPACEKEY>/pages/<PageID>}}*

h3. Actual Results
 * Link currently points to:
*{{http:///wiki/spaces/<SPACEKEY>/pages/<PageID>}}*

h3. Workaround
* Add a link to the page by using /link or {link and the exported file will have the links correctly pointing to Confluence's page.
fields.summary: Exporting Word pages containing links to other pages end up with broken links

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A nice feature that allows bringing relevance to a page in an anonymous space is that we can add that page on the indexing of a search engine, like Google, for example. This way, as much as that page is accessed from a Google search or a Google Chrome browser, it escalates its relevance when someone else searches for this page on that search engine.

Currently, we are allowing search engines to index resolved inline comments, which makes anonymous users face a "_This is a restricted page_" message, as when they access it, the page renders, and right after it, the resolved comments modal appears, then the restricted page message.

h3. Suggestion
* It would be appreciated if we could restrict search engines do index only Confluence pages' endpoints and nothing else in order to avoid this kind of misfortune.
fields.summary: Search engines are indexing resolved inline comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a specific date field has a limited context on Jira to appear on specific projects only, that field won't be listed as an option on Team Calendar's Jira Issue Dates events if the JQL query used includes any issue from another project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *Date Picker* field on Jira, e.g.: "Test Date Picker Field"
# Limit its context to a certain project only, let's say project ABC
# On Team Calendars, create a new *Jira Issue Dates* event
# Use a JQL that includes a different project, such as 
{code:none}project in (ABC, DEF) and "Test Date Picker Field" is not empty{code}

h3. Expected Results
The "Test Date Picker Field" custom field should be listed.

h3. Actual Results
The field is not listed.

h3. Workaround
Currently, the field is only listed if using the specific project *only*.
Based on that, limiting the JQL to the projects included on the field's context should allow the field to be listed.
fields.summary: Specific date fields are not listed on Team Calendar's Jira Issue Dates events

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Certain special characters don't behave correctly in title CQL searches
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a special ascii character in the title 
 # Try exact match CQL query title = 
 # Try fuzzy match CQL query title ~

h3. Expected Results

The relevant page with special character is returned 
h3. Actual Results

Varied. Exact match searches on pages with double quotes in the title don't work at all. Exact match searches for ` will also return results with ^ in the same position. Other characters like : need to be escaped to be searched on. 
h3. Workaround

Most special characters will behave correctly if escaped with \ in the query.
fields.summary: Title CQL query doesn't behave as expected with all special characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team Calendars allows users to [subscribe to existing Google calendars|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/subscribe-to-google-calendars-from-confluence/], using an ICAL link. By doing this integration, changes performed on Google should reflect on Confluence.

However, if you create a recurrent event on Google Calendars, and delete one of them, the deletion won't reflect to Team Calendars. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a calendar o Google Calendars.
 # Create a recurring event.
 # Collect the ICAL link on Google, to use it on TC.
 # On Team Calendars, choose to *Subscribe by URL*.
 # Create the subscription.
 # On Google, delete *one* event from the recurrence.

h3. Expected Results

The event should be deleted on Team Calendars too, as the integration was created.
h3. Actual Results

The event is still displayed on Team Calendars.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting one event from a recurrence event on Google Calendars won't reflect to Team Calendars subscription

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to our [documentation for page conversion|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/convert-pages-to-the-new-editor/], the *Section macr**o* is completely converted to the new editor. However, if your Legacy page has a numbered list with images within this macro, the page will look different on the view mode. On the conversion preview, the images are still correctly aligned, as well as on the page's edit mode. However, on the view mode, the images are wrongly aligned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page on the Legacy editor.
 # Add the section macro on it.
 # Place a numbered list within the macro.
 # Add images to the numbered list.
 # Convert the page.

h3. Expected Results

The page should respect its alignment, as it does on the edit mode:

!image-2020-09-21-12-33-49-457.png!
h3. Actual Results

After converting the page, the list alignment is different on the view mode:

!image-2020-09-21-12-34-43-804.png!
h3. Workaround

Edit the page, copy the numbered list and paste it outside of the section macro (remove the content from the macro).
fields.summary: Converting a page that has numbered lists with images within a section macro will break the page's structure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the mobile app Confluence for Android, even though the table cells has colors 
 applied on the same, it doesn't reflect on the published page on the app, but if you click on edit, it shows up the colors as expected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Insert a table
 # Change the color in some cells of that table
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The table cells colors shows up as expected.
h3. Actual Results

There is no table cell colors in the published page when accessing it on the mobile app for Confluence on Android, but it shows up on the edit mode.
h3. Workaround

* Click on the edit button, when accessing the page in the mobile app for Android, the colors will show up there.

* Alternatively, in the settings screen, turn new page viewing experience switch to on (table cell colors are supported in this experience)
fields.summary: Table cells colors don't show up on the Published page on the Confluence App for Android , only in edit mode.

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary The [Inline Task Search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-inline-tasks/#api-api-inlinetasks-search-get] endpoint does not encode special characters like other Confluence REST APIs. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a Confluence page # In that page, create a new inline tasks with a body like "I’m a task body with a special character" # Retrieve the body of the task via the Inline Task Search REST API. h3. Expected Results For the body of the task: {code:java} I’m a task body with a special character {code} Notice how "’" is correctly encoded to "’". This is also the way all other Confluence REST APIs return the content.   h3. Actual Results The "’" is not being encoded: {noformat} I’m a task body with a special character {noformat} h3. Workaround Users of the REST API have to manually sanitize the task bodies they get from the Inline Task Search REST API before they can work with them, as they can otherwise break tools or services that require the characters to be encoded correctly.
fields.summary: Correctly HTML-encode special characters in Inline Task Search REST API

fields.description: As a Confluence Cloud user, I want to set the sort order of the "children display" macro to be reverse of the page order that the pages are in so that the pages are in the appropriate order for my use case; page order is something controllable while creation/modification dates aren't and our titles are not alphabetical.
fields.summary: Add "page order" option for "Sort Children By" property of "Children Display" macro

fields.description:
h3. *Requirement:* 

Change copy to _*"Search* *people and teams"*_
h3. Issue Summary

With the recent implementation of the new People Directory, it's no longer possible to list all people on the Confluence People Directory (differing from what's indicated on [this public documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/search-the-people-directory/]). However, there's still an option to do so, which doesn't work as indicated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Confluence.
 # Navigate to *People > View all people and teams*.

h3. Expected Results

As the button indicates to display *all people and teams*, all users should be displayed.

!image-2020-09-17-16-08-49-276.png!
h3. Actual Results

Only the people who have most recently collaborated on the same content as you will be displayed.
h3. Workaround

If the user is a site-admin, it's possible to find a list of all Confluence users on the Instance administration.
fields.summary: View all people on People Directory doesn't work as indicated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When exporting a space, specially large ones, the timer does not represent the actual time to complete the whole export.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a space with complex and large pages, with many pages and child pages. 
# Go to Space Settings > Content Tools > Export
 # Choose PDF and export the space;

h3. Expected Results
* Timer should represent accurately the time for the process to complete.

h3. Actual Results
* Timer does not represent time to completion acurately, and may present users with a wrong estimate


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Space Export timer is not acurate

fields.description:
h3. Current Situation
* When [exporting a space|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/export-content-to-word-pdf-html-and-xml/] at the end of the process a file is generated and users can download the final file.
* The only downside is that users have to wait for the whole process to finish, without closing their browser/tab.

h3. Desired Functionality
* Similar to [Site Backup|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-a-site-backup/] it would be great if space exports could be accessed after the process has finished, without requiring the user to wait for the whole process;
* This would be useful in cases where there's a large space to export.
fields.summary: Space exports should mantain the exported file, so users can access it later, without having to wait for the whole export to finish

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the include page macro, if the page to be included contains an image and some text after the image, if the same image is aligned to the left or right, all the text in the page is wrapped, even though it was not used the option to wrap to left or right.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Add any image (.png, .jpg .jpeg)
 # Add some text below the image
# Align it to the left or right (the text will stay at left by default)
# Publish the page
# Create a new page
# Insert the include page macro
# Choose the page created previously
# Publish the second page

h3. Expected Results
The page with the include page macro displays the content the same way it is showing up on the first page to be included the content.

h3. Actual Results
The words are wrapped as it was used the wrap alignment.

h3. Workaround
Use the Align Center instead of left or right alignment and the text won't be wrapped.
fields.summary: If an image is aligned to left or right in a page, the text on the page is wrapped with the image in the include page macro
Numbered fields break the Filter Results widget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Nested macro's in the new editor experience result in endless stream of requests to Confluence
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Put a static macro from a connect app (for example numbered headings) on a page in the new editor experience.
 # Next another macro inside, for example the info panel.

h3. Expected Results

The macro should display correctly on the page
h3. Actual Results

Check the network tab in the browser, it shows an endless stream of calls to /convert/storage
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Nested macro's in the new editor experience result in endless stream of requests to Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In some cases, when a page has a high number of tables and other elements, clicking on the "make page full-width" / "make page fixed-width" button multiple times can remove tables from the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page (storage format:  [^CONFCLOUD-70791.html] )
 # Publish the page and edit it again
 # Click on the "make page full-width" / "make page fixed-width" button to resize the page
 # Repeat step 3 until the page automatically scrolls down and some of the tables are removed

h3. Expected Results
The page should keep all of its contents

h3. Actual Results
Some/ all the tables are removed from the editor


h3. Workaround
* When this happens, hitting Ctrl+Z / command+Z a couple of times will restore the draft's contents. 
* Alternatively, if the page was published, revert it to a previous version through *•••* -> *Page History*.
fields.summary: The "make page full-width" button can remove tables from complex pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *Contributors Summary* macro is showing 0 results for any field besides *Edits*. Also, Last updated field is not correct

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add the *Contributors Summary* macro
# Set the space key and select the desired fields (tested with "edits,comments,labels,watches")
# Save the macro and publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The macro should list the respective values for all fields

h3. Actual Results
Only the *Edits* field displays a value different than 0

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Contributors Summary is showing 0 results for Comments, Labels, Watches and any other field besides Edits

fields.description:
When trying to archive a Confluence page and its 1000+ nested pages, an error message appears saying 'We couldn't archive this page' after ~20 or so seconds.

It turns out that the pages _were_ archived, however, the job too longer than expected, causing the error. From Soum Ghoshal:
{quote}So what happens is that we have a timeout on the front-end where it expects archival to be done by 20 seconds so it can display the success message. But since this was a pretty big archival operation, you mentioned 1136 pages in total? It timed out and showed the error flag. But actually the operation still was getting processed on the BE.
{quote}
It would be great if the error message instead stated that the job is taking longer than expected and to check back soon.
fields.summary: Enhanced Error Message

fields.description:
For accountability and traceability, admins may need the ability to enforce users to leave a note/comment when a page is edited. 

The ability to add comments during publish was rolled out recently in the new editor. See [this|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65695?focusedCommentId=2507815&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-2507815] for more info.
fields.summary: Setting to make publishing with comments mandatory

fields.description:
When editing a Confluence page, all the Jira tickets/issues and/or filters appear as gray boxes that you cannot read. This is frustrating when one is running a meeting and has lots of Jira issues and filters on a page. As one types notes/actions and meeting notes, all the Jira issues and filters revert to grey boxes.

What I have been doing whilst running meetings, is to present my published meeting page in the Zoom meeting and then on my second screen, type the notes, meetings and actions but this is frustrating as every 5-10 minutes I need to publish my edits and notes and then refresh the shared meeting page that is being shared live in the meeting.

As I use many Jira filters and Jira issues in a meeting page, it is also quite painful when I need to copy and edit a meeting page, again, as the Jira issues appear only as a grey box with an issue number and one cannot read what the issue is so one has to have a second page open to keep reverting to what one is actually looking at.

This seems quite painful for two very clever systems - is there a way around this?
fields.summary: Show/read Jira tickets/filters whilst editing a Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Specifying a label on Livesearch macro does not affect results from both the dropdown search results preview and the See more results for option

When a user sets the search parameters within the macro to be restricted to a specific label, _+the results shown in the preview within the dropdown are incorrect.+_

_+If the user clicks show more the results are also incorrect.+_

However, if the user presses the enter/return key to send the search, the results show on the search page are correct.

In the first video, _+you can see the incorrect behavior in both the preview and the full search page:+_

  !Screen-Recording-2020-09-11-at-1.gif|width=393,height=280!

Here, in the second video you can see +_the expected results by pressing the enter/return key:_+

  !Screen-Recording-2020-09-11-at-1(1).gif|width=394,height=280!  

By looking at the second video, you can see that the label value is only passed through to the search when pressing enter/return.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create pages
 # Add a label to those pages
 # Create a new page
 # Place a Livesearch macro in it
 # Limit the search scope to content containing the label you created earlier
 # Save the macro
 # Publish the page
 # Search for the pages you created earlier for this test

h3. Expected Results

Only the content with the label will show in the preview and the "See more results for" option
h3. Actual Results

Any content with the search string will show up
h3. Workaround

Instead of relying on the preview or the "See more results for" option, press enter/return to be redirected into the full search page.
fields.summary: Specifying a label on Livesearch macro does not affect results from both the dropdown search results preview and the See more results for option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the Legacy editor, if you create a Layout, and insert a Heading 1 or 2 inside of it, the macro will work, but scroll arrows will be displayed when accessing the page on view mode. The text will be cut off as well.

(i) This bug only affects the Legacy editor.

(i) This bug only affects Windows. I wasn't able to reproduce it on macOS.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the Legacy editor.
 # Add a layout on it, and a Heading (1 or 2) inside of it.
 # Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

The layouts should render properly (screenshot taken from macOS):

!image-2020-09-11-12-55-29-932.png!
h3. Actual Results

The layouts are cut off, and have scroll arrows:

!image-2020-09-11-12-59-05-653.png|width=1038,height=267!
h3. Workaround

(on) This behavior affects Google Chrome and Edge, but it doesn't affect Firefox. So, if possible, load the page on Firefox.

Or, editing the page and adding a new line after the Heading, would fix it.
fields.summary: Headings 1 and 2 inside layouts on the Legacy editor are not working properly on Windows

fields.description:
h3. Current Situation

Setting up Confluence's homepage [According to this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/configuring-the-site-home-page-724765517.html] ends up creating a new button on the top bar, with the same name as the selected space.

For example, I have set the space STONKS to be Confluence's homepage on my own instance:

Clicking either *Confluence's Logo*, or *Stonks Home* button will take me to STONKS homepage. ([https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/]<SpaceKey>/overview?mode=global)

!emg1.png!

By Clicking *Home* the user will be taken to Confluence's Recently worked/viewed spaces/pages ([https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/home])

!emg2.png!
h3. Desired Behavior
 * Allow users to change the link of the *Home* button to their Custom homepage ([https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/]<SpaceKey>/overview?mode=global);
 * Change the link of *Confluence's Logo*, or *SPACE Home* button to Recently worked/viewed spaces/pages ([https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/home]);
 * Basically allowing users to switch the link destination of these buttons
* Allow users to fully remove one of these buttons

*(on) Confluence's Logo*, or *SPACE Home* > ([https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/home])
(on) *Home* button > ([https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/]<SpaceKey>/overview?mode=global)
fields.summary: Allow users to change the destination on Confluence logo, SPACE home and HOME buttons
